sentences.sContent: I saw her tap dancing on our kitchen floor.
sentences.sContent_eng: I saw her tap dancing on our kitchen floor.
sentences.sCn: 我看到她在厨房的地板上跳踢踏舞；

sentences.sContent: Yes, he's a pimp. He's a big, tap dancing pimp!
sentences.sContent_eng: Yes, he's a pimp. He's a big, tap dancing pimp!
sentences.sCn: 他是个拉皮条的，他是个喜欢半夜起来跳踢踏舞的拉皮条的。

sentences.sContent: The other one, Cameron 's movie [Elizabethtown], she starts tap dancing.
sentences.sContent_eng: The other one, Cameron 's movie [Elizabethtown], she starts tap dancing.
sentences.sCn: 另一部影片，卡梅隆的（《伊丽莎白镇》），主角开始跳踢踏舞。

trans.tranOther: dancing in which you wear shoes with pieces of metal on the bottom, which make a sound as you move
